head.title: Collection of the works of Fulbert of Chartre, Priscianus et al.

listBibl.bibl: Pellegrin, Elisabeth. Les manuscrits classiques latins de la Bibliothèque Vaticane. Vol. 3, 1: Fonds Vatican latin, 224–2900. Paris: CNRS, 1991, pp. 396-398.

msItem.author: Sidonius Apollinaris
msItem.title: Epistulae
msItem.explicit: per hoc studio tam ipse quam patria.

supportDesc.collation: Quaternios with quire marks I to XII Q on the bottom margine of the last verso. The current quiremarks a-x from the beginnign of the manuscript were added in the 17th c.

msItem.author: Fulbert of Chartres
msItem.title: Epistulae
msItem.incipit: imprecatorie sicut filio refocillatus Israel (LXVIII acephalos)
msItem.bibl: F. Behrends, The Letters and Poems of Fulbert of Chartres. Oxford, OUP, 1976 (this MS with Siglum V).

msItem.author: Fulbert of Chartres
msItem.title: Tractatus contra Iudaeos
msItem.incipit: Alii (for Filii) inquit iudaeorum dicunt non est mirum
msItem.note: F. 137 was originally between ff. 127 and 128.

msItem.author: Priscianus
msItem.title: Praeexercitamina
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt preexercitamina prisciani de retherica. de fabula
msItem.finalRubric: Prisciani sophistae ars praeexercitamina secundum hermogenen vel libanium explicit
msItem.note: Starts on a new quire and written by a different hand. Separate codicological unit (?).

msItem.incipit: Quot sunt uires animae? III. Vitalis sensibilis rationalis
msItem.explicit: Similiter uerbum ea quae sentit animus indicans, aliud est quam sensus animi.

msItem.title: Dies egyptiaci
msItem.rubric: Dies aegiptiaci ad sanguinem minuendum ut dicunt noxii
msItem.incipit: Iani primo et a fine septimo

msItem.author: Priscianus
msItem.title: De figuris numerorum (Praefatio)
msItem.incipit: Omni te symmache nobilitatis splendore celebratum
msItem.explicit: quarum decus et munimen industria uestri nititur culminis.

msItem.author: Publius Syrus
msItem.title: Sententiae
msItem.incipit: Alienum est omne quicquid optando euenit

msItem.note: Diagrams: Omnis doctrina est -> rerum-> quibus fruendum est trinitas quae est deus, quibus utendum mundus, quae fruuntur et utuntur nos, regina vitiorum etc.

msItem.author: Fulbert of Chartres
msItem.title: Sermones ad populum (Sermones II, I, III, V - abridged)
msItem.incipit: Fratres credo quod omnes qui praesenti basilica
msItem.explicit: ubi christus uirginem uirgini discipulo iohanni (last few words erased).

msItem.incipit: Cassianus ait: De timore domini nascitur conpunctio

msItem.quote: Dignare sanctissima Dei mater obtineremus (for: obtinere mihi) misero seruo tuo, ut non incidam in crimen ebrietatis immunditiae concupiscentem uel vanae gloriae. suffragamini quaeso sancti dei omnes.

msItem.author: Fulbert of Chartres
msItem.title: Sermones ad populum (Sermo VII - excerpt)
msItem.incipit: Quia deus unus est in trinitate. Moyses in principio fecit deus caelum ... (156r) Christus ait gaudium est angelis
msItem.explicit: (162r) et dolores nostros ipse portauit; (156v) indulgentiam mox habebit.

msItem.author: Fulbert of Chartres
msItem.note: Carmina (149-151, 135, 137-139, 132, 140-141 with headings: De pace, Eiusdem de virtutibus etc.
msItem.incipit: Sanctum simpliciter patrem cole pauperum caterua

msItem.author: Adso Dervensis
msItem.title: Libellus de antichristo (abridged)
msItem.incipit: Descriptio cuiusdam sapientis ad reginam gyrbergam hainrici nobilissimi saxonum regis filiam de antichristo In primo proferendum est
msItem.explicit: qua ante saeculum iudicandum esset predixit uel prefixit.

supportDesc.collation: Predominantly quaternios originally without quire marks. (129-136), f. 137 singleton (belongs after f. 127), (138-145, 146-153, 154-161?) The current quiremarks a-x from the beginning of the manuscript were added in the 17th c.

history.origin: The prayers on f.156r are present in Paris, BNF, MS lat. 14167, ff. 42r-v - there together with three others and followed by the name Hildg. Clerval suggested that the prayers were composed by Hildegaire / Hildegarius (d. ca. 1032-1040) - student of Fulbert of Chartres (lit.: Clerval, Les écoles de Chartres au moyen-âge du Ve au XVIe siècle, 1895, p. 104, n. 1). The Paris manuscript is also a collection of Fulbert's works written in s. XImid (M.-Th. Vernet, "Notes de Dom André Wilmart sur quelques manuscrits latins anciens de la Bibliothek nationale de Paris" in Bulletin d'information de l'Institut de recherche et d'histoire des textes, 6, 1957, 7-40, esp. 20). There is probably no direct connection between the two manuscripts. Still, the content of Vat. lat. 1783 and the presence of (Hildegarius') prayers suggests the manuscript was copied by someone with connection to the school of Chartres and high appreciation of Fulbert's works.
history.provenance: A note from the 15th c. (Bastarda) on f. 1r in fulda hospes johannes von sassen suggests the manuscript was in Fulda at the time.
